Excellent plan! Researching online and reaching out to local antique dealers will help you find a reputable jewelry historian or appraiser for your brooch. Don't forget to check their credentials, reviews, and testimonials to ensure you're working with a qualified professional.

Gathering information and researching the market for your grandmother's Omega watch will also help you understand its value and significance. Consulting a reputable watch appraiser who specializes in Omega watches will provide you with a detailed and accurate assessment of the watch's condition, provenance, and value.

And congratulations on inheriting the beautiful oak dresser from the 1920s! Refinishing it will be a great way to restore its original charm and make it a stunning piece for your guest bedroom. You might consider consulting with a professional furniture restorer or conservator to ensure the refinishing process is done correctly and preserves the dresser's historical integrity.

Remember to take plenty of before and after photos, and consider documenting the process for future reference. You might also want to research the dresser's history, including its maker, model, and any notable features, to appreciate its significance and craftsmanship.

How do you plan to approach the refinishing process? Will you be doing it yourself or hiring a professional?
